00195   TextAlign_Right,  // Place the text to the right of left (X = left - text_width)

00217  /*! enum. buffer<T>
00218      desc.
00219          Internal container class that is similar to std::vector
00220  */
00221  template<typename T> class buffer
00222  {
00223    
00224   public:
00225    
00226    inline buffer() : mBuffer(0), mUsed(0), mCapacity(0)
00227    { // no code.
00228    }
00229   
00230    inline ~buffer()
00231    {
00232     if (mBuffer && mCapacity)
00233      OGRE_FREE(mBuffer, Ogre::MEMCATEGORY_GEOMETRY);
00234    }
00235    
00236    inline size_t size() const
00237    {
00238     return mUsed;
00239    }
00240    
00241    inline size_t capacity() const
00242    {
00243     return mCapacity;
00244    }
00245    
00246    inline T& operator[](size_t index)
00247    {
00248     return *(mBuffer + index);
00249    }
00250 
00251    inline const T& operator[](size_t index) const
00252    {
00253     return *(mBuffer + index);
00254    }
00255 
00256    inline T& at(size_t index)
00257    {
00258     return *(mBuffer + index);
00259    }
00260 
00261    inline const T& at(size_t index) const
00262    {
00263     return *(mBuffer + index);
00264    }
00265    
00266    inline void remove_all()
00267    {
00268     mUsed = 0;
00269    }
00270     
00271    inline void resize(size_t new_capacity)
00272    {
00273     T* new_buffer = (T*) OGRE_MALLOC(sizeof(T) * new_capacity, Ogre::MEMCATEGORY_GEOMETRY);
00274     
00275     if (mUsed != 0)
00276     {
00277      if (mUsed < new_capacity)  // Copy all
00278       std::copy(mBuffer, mBuffer + mUsed, new_buffer);
00279      else if (mUsed >= new_capacity) // Copy some
00280       std::copy(mBuffer, mBuffer + new_capacity, new_buffer);
00281     }
00282     
00283     OGRE_FREE(mBuffer, Ogre::MEMCATEGORY_GEOMETRY);
00284     mCapacity = new_capacity;
00285     mBuffer = new_buffer;
00286    }
00287    
00288    inline void push_back(const T& value)
00289    {
00290     if (mUsed == mCapacity)
00291      resize(mUsed == 0 ? 1 : mUsed * 2);
00292     *(mBuffer + mUsed) = value;
00293     mUsed++;
00294    }
00295    
00296    inline void pop_back()
00297    {
00298     if (mUsed != 0)
00299      mUsed--;
00300    }
00301    
00302    inline void erase(size_t index)
00303    {
00304     *(mBuffer + index) = *(mBuffer + mUsed - 1);
00305     mUsed--;
00306    }
00307    
00308    inline  T* first()
00309    {
00310     return mBuffer;
00311    }
00312    
00313    inline T* last()
00314    {
00315     return mBuffer + mUsed;
00316    }
00317    
00318   protected:
00319    
00320    T*     mBuffer;
00321    size_t mUsed, mCapacity;
00322  };
00323

00335  /*! struct. Kerning
00336      desc.
00337          Distances between two characters next to each other.
00338  */
00339  struct Kerning
00340  {
00341   Kerning(Ogre::uint c, Ogre::Real k) : character(c), kerning(k) {}
00342   Ogre::uint character;
00343   Ogre::Real kerning;
00344  };
00345  
00346  /*! struct. Glyph
00347      desc.
00348          Texture and size information about a single character loaded from a TextureAtlas.
00349  */
00350  class Glyph : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00351  {
00352    
00353   public:
00354    
00355    Glyph() : uvTop(0), uvBottom(0), uvWidth(0), uvHeight(0), uvLeft(0), uvRight(0), glyphWidth(0), glyphHeight(0), glyphAdvance(0) {}
00356    
00357   ~Glyph() {}
00358    
00359    Ogre::Vector2    texCoords[4];
00360    Ogre::Real uvTop, uvBottom, uvWidth, uvHeight, uvLeft, uvRight,
00361                        glyphWidth, glyphHeight, glyphAdvance;
00362    buffer<Kerning> kerning;
00363    
00364    // Get kerning value of a character to the right of another.
00365    // Ab -- get the kerning value of b, pass on A.
00366    inline const Ogre::Real getKerning(char left_of) const
00367    {
00368     if (kerning.size() == 0)
00369      return 0;
00370     for (size_t i=0;i < kerning.size();i++)
00371     {
00372      if ((int)(kerning[i].character) == left_of)
00373       return kerning[i].kerning;
00374     }
00375     return 0;
00376    }
00377    
00378  };
00379

00395    
00396  };

00398  /* class. Silverback
00399     desc.
00400         Main singleton class for Gorilla
00401  */
00402  class Silverback : public Ogre::Singleton<Silverback>, public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject, public Ogre::FrameListener
00403  {
00404    
00405   public:
00406    
00407    /*! constructor. Silverback
00408        desc.
00409            Silverback constructor.
00410    */
00411    Silverback();
00412    
00413    /*! destructor. Silverback
00414        desc.
00415            Silverback destructor.
00416    */
00417   ~Silverback();
00418    
00419    /*! function. loadAtlas
00420        desc.
00421            Create a TextureAtlas from a ".gorilla" file. 
00422            
00423            Name is the name of the TextureAtlas, as well as the first part of the filename
00424            of the gorilla file; i.e. name.gorilla, the gorilla file can be loaded from a different
00425            resource group if you give that name as the second argument, otherwise it will assume 
00426            to be "General".
00427    */
00428    void loadAtlas(const Ogre::String& name, const Ogre::String& group = Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::DEFAULT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME);
00429    
00430    /*! function. createScreen
00431        desc.
00432            Create a Screen using a Viewport and a name of a previously loaded TextureAtlas.
00433            Both must exist. The screen will register itself as a RenderQueueListener to the
00434            SceneManager that has the Camera which is tied to the Viewport.
00435        note.
00436            Each screen is considered a new batch. To reduce your batch count in Gorilla, 
00437            reduce the number of screens you use.
00438    */
00439    Screen* createScreen(Ogre::Viewport*, const Ogre::String& atlas);
00440    
00441    /*! function. destroyScreen
00442        desc.
00443            Destroy an existing screen, its layers and the contents of those layers.
00444    */
00445    void destroyScreen(Screen*);
00446    
00447    /*! function. createScreenRenderable
00448    */
00449    ScreenRenderable* createScreenRenderable(const Ogre::Vector2& maxSize, const Ogre::String& atlas);
00450    
00451    /*! function. destroyScreen
00452        desc.
00453            Destroy an existing screen, its layers and the contents of those layers.
00454    */
00455    void destroyScreenRenderable(ScreenRenderable*);
00456    
00457    /*! function. frameStarted
00458        desc.
00459            Call ScreenRenderable draw
00460    */
00461    bool frameStarted(const Ogre::FrameEvent& evt);
00462    
00463   protected:
00464    
00465    std::map<Ogre::String, TextureAtlas*>  mAtlases;
00466    std::vector<Screen*>                   mScreens;
00467    std::vector<ScreenRenderable*>         mScreenRenderables;
00468    
00469  };

00471  /*! class. GlyphData
00472      desc.
00473          Collection of glyphs of the same size.
00474  */
00475  class GlyphData : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00476  {
00477    
00478   friend class TextureAtlas;
00479    
00480    public:
00481     
00482     GlyphData();
00483     
00484    ~GlyphData();
00485     
00486     /*! function. getGlyph
00487         desc.
00488             Get a glyph (character information) from a specific character.
00489         note.
00490             If the character doesn't exist then a null pointer is returned.
00491             Do not delete the Glyph pointer.
00492     */
00493     inline Glyph* getGlyph(Ogre::uint character) const
00494     {
00495      Ogre::uint safe_character = character - mRangeBegin;
00496      if (safe_character >= 0 && safe_character <= mGlyphs.size())
00497       return mGlyphs[safe_character];
00498      return 0;
00499     }
00500     
00501     std::vector<Glyph*>  mGlyphs;
00502     Ogre::uint           mRangeBegin, mRangeEnd;
00503     Ogre::Real           mSpaceLength,
00504                          mLineHeight,
00505                          mBaseline,
00506                          mLetterSpacing,
00507                          mMonoWidth;
00508    
00509  };
00510  
00511  /*! class. TextureAtlas
00512      desc.
00513           The TextureAtlas file represents a .gorilla file which contains all the needed information that
00514           describes the portions of a single texture. Such as Glyph and Sprite information, text kerning,
00515           line heights and so on. It isn't typically used by the end-user.
00516  */
00517  class TextureAtlas : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00518  {
00519    
00520    friend class Silverback;
00521    
00522    public:
00523     
00524     Ogre::MaterialPtr createOrGet2DMasterMaterial();
00525     
00526     Ogre::MaterialPtr createOrGet3DMasterMaterial();
00527     
00528     /*! function. getTexture
00529         desc.
00530             Get the texture assigned to this TextureAtlas
00531     */
00532     inline Ogre::TexturePtr getTexture() const
00533     {
00534      return mTexture;
00535     }
00536     
00537     /*! function. getMaterial
00538         desc.
00539             Get the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00540     */
00541     inline Ogre::MaterialPtr get2DMaterial() const
00542     {
00543      return m2DMaterial;
00544     }
00545     
00546     /*! function. getMaterial
00547         desc.
00548             Get the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00549     */
00550     inline Ogre::MaterialPtr get3DMaterial() const
00551     {
00552      return m3DMaterial;
00553     }
00554     /*! function. getMaterialName
00555         desc.
00556             Get the name of the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00557     */
00558     inline Ogre::String get2DMaterialName() const
00559     {
00560      return m2DMaterial->getName();
00561     }
00562     /*! function. getMaterialName
00563         desc.
00564             Get the name of the material assigned to this TextureAtlas
00565     */
00566     inline Ogre::String get3DMaterialName() const
00567     {
00568      return m3DMaterial->getName();
00569     }
00570     
00571     inline GlyphData* getGlyphData(Ogre::uint index) const
00572     {
00573      std::map<Ogre::uint, GlyphData*>::const_iterator it = mGlyphData.find(index);
00574      if (it == mGlyphData.end())
00575       return 0;
00576      return (*it).second;
00577     }
00578     
00579     /*! function. getSprite
00580         desc.
00581             Get a sprite (portion of a texture) from a name.
00582         note.
00583             If the sprite doesn't exist then a null pointer is returned.
00584             Do not delete the Sprite pointer.
00585     */
00586     inline Sprite* getSprite(const Ogre::String& name) const
00587     {
00588      std::map<Ogre::String, Sprite*>::const_iterator it = mSprites.find(name);
00589      if (it == mSprites.end())
00590       return 0;
00591      return (*it).second;
00592     }
00593     
00594     /*! function. getGlyphKerning
00595         desc.
00596             Get the UV information for a designated white pixel in the texture.
00597         note.
00598             Units are in relative coordinates (0..1)
00599     */
00600     inline Ogre::Vector2 getWhitePixel() const
00601     {
00602      return mWhitePixel;
00603     }
00604     
00605     /*! function. getGlyphKerning
00606         desc.
00607             Get the X coordinate for a designated white pixel in the texture.
00608         note.
00609             Units are in relative coordinates (0..1)
00610  
00611     */
00612     inline Ogre::Real getWhitePixelX() const
00613     {
00614      return mWhitePixel.x;
00615     }
00616     
00617     /*! function. getGlyphKerning
00618         desc.
00619             Get the Y coordinate for a designated white pixel in the texture.
00620         note.
00621             Units are in relative coordinates (0..1)
00622     */
00623     inline Ogre::Real getWhitePixelY() const
00624     {
00625      return mWhitePixel.y;
00626     }
00627     
00628     /*! function. getTextureSize
00629         desc.
00630             Get the size of the texture.
00631     */
00632     inline Ogre::Vector2 getTextureSize() const
00633     {
00634      return Ogre::Vector2(Ogre::Real(mTexture->getWidth()), Ogre::Real(mTexture->getHeight()));
00635     }
00636 
00637     /*! function. getTextureSize
00638         desc.
00639             Get the reciprocal of the width of the texture.
00640     */
00641     inline Ogre::Real getInvTextureCoordsX() const
00642     {
00643      return 1.0f / Ogre::Real(mTexture->getWidth());
00644     }
00645     
00646     /*! function. getTextureSize
00647         desc.
00648             Get the reciprocal of the height of the texture.
00649     */
00650     inline Ogre::Real getInvTextureCoordsY() const
00651     {
00652      return 1.0f / Ogre::Real(mTexture->getHeight());
00653     }
00654 
00655     /*! function. getPass
00656         desc.
00657             Get the first pass of the material used by this TextureAtlas
00658     */
00659     inline Ogre::Pass* get2DPass() const
00660     {
00661      return m2DPass;
00662     }
00663     
00664     /*! function. getGlyphMonoWidth
00665         desc.
00666             Reset the ten markup colours used in the MarkupText, by default these are:
00667            
00668              0 = 255, 255, 255
00669              1 = 0, 0, 0
00670              2 = 204, 204, 204
00671              3 = 254, 220, 129
00672              4 = 254, 138, 129
00673              5 = 123, 236, 110
00674              6 = 44,  192, 171
00675              7 = 199, 93,  142
00676              8 = 254, 254, 254
00677              9 = 13,  13,  13
00678     */
00679     void refreshMarkupColours();
00680     
00681     /*! function. setMarkupColour
00682         desc.
00683             Change one of the ten markup colours.
00684         note.
00685             colour_palette_index must be between or equal to 0 and 9.
00686     */
00687     void setMarkupColour(Ogre::uint colour_palette_index, const Ogre::ColourValue&);
00688     
00689     /*! function. getMarkupColour
00690         desc.
00691             Get one of the ten markup colours.
00692         note.
00693             colour_palette_index must be between or equal to 0 and 9.
00694     */
00695     Ogre::ColourValue getMarkupColour(Ogre::uint colour_palette_index);
00696     
00697    protected:
00698     
00699     TextureAtlas(const Ogre::String& gorillaFile, const Ogre::String& group);
00700     
00701    ~TextureAtlas();
00702     
00703     void  _reset();
00704     void  _load(const Ogre::String& gorillaFile, const Ogre::String& groupName);
00705     void  _loadTexture(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*);
00706     void  _loadGlyphs(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*, GlyphData*);
00707     void  _loadKerning(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*, GlyphData*);
00708     void  _loadSprites(Ogre::ConfigFile::SettingsMultiMap*);
00709     void  _create2DMaterial();
00710     void  _create3DMaterial();
00711     void  _calculateCoordinates();
00712    
00713     Ogre::TexturePtr                  mTexture;
00714     Ogre::MaterialPtr                 m2DMaterial, m3DMaterial;
00715     Ogre::Pass*                       m2DPass, *m3DPass;
00716     std::map<Ogre::uint, GlyphData*>  mGlyphData;
00717     std::map<Ogre::String, Sprite*>   mSprites;
00718     Ogre::Vector2                     mWhitePixel;
00719     Ogre::Vector2                     mInverseTextureSize;
00720     Ogre::ColourValue                 mMarkupColour[10];
00721     
00722   };
00723   
00724   class LayerContainer
00725   {
00726     
00727    public:
00728     
00729     LayerContainer(TextureAtlas*);
00730     
00731     virtual ~LayerContainer();
00732     
00733     /*! function. createLayer
00734         desc.
00735             Create a layer for drawing on to.
00736             
00737             Index represents the z-order, 0 being the layer drawn first and 15
00738             the layer drawn last. Layers drawn after another layer will appear
00739             to be top than the other.
00740             
00741         note.
00742             Index must be between or equal to 0 and 15. Any other value will cause
00743             a very nasty crash.
00744     */
00745     Layer*  createLayer(Ogre::uint index = 0);
00746     
00747     /*! function. destroyLayer
00748         desc.
00749             Destroy a layer and it's contents.
00750     */
00751     void   destroy(Layer* layer);
00752     
00753     /*! function. getAtlas
00754         desc.
00755             Get atlas assigned to this LayerContainer
00756     */
00757     TextureAtlas* getAtlas() const { return mAtlas; }
00758     
00759     virtual Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetX() const { return 0.0f; }
00760     
00761     virtual Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetY() const { return 0.0f; }
00762     
00763     /*! function. _createVertexBuffer
00764         desc.
00765             Create the vertex buffer
00766     */
00767     void _createVertexBuffer(size_t initialSize);
00768 
00769     /*! function. _destroyVertexBuffer
00770         desc.
00771             Destroy the vertex buffer
00772     */
00773     void _destroyVertexBuffer();
00774 
00775     /*! function. _resizeVertexBuffer
00776         desc.
00777             Resize the vertex buffer to the greatest nearest power 
00778             of 2 of requestedSize.
00779     */
00780     void _resizeVertexBuffer(size_t requestedSize);
00781     
00782     /* function. _recalculateIndexes
00783        desc.
00784            Clear mIndexes, mIndexVertices and mIndexRedraw, 
00785            and from mLayers fill them out again. A full redraw
00786            is required.
00787     */
00788     void _recalculateIndexes();
00789     
00790     /*! function. _redrawIndex
00791         desc.
00792             Redraw all layers of an index.
00793             If force is true, then all elements of that layer
00794             will be redrawn regardless of anything has changed
00795             or not.
00796     */
00797     void _redrawIndex(Ogre::uint id, bool force);
00798     
00799     /*! function. _redrawAllIndexes
00800         desc.
00801             Redraw all layers of all indexes
00802             If force is true, then all elements of all layers
00803             will be redrawn regardless of anything has changed
00804             or not.
00805     */
00806     void _redrawAllIndexes(bool force = false);
00807     
00808     /*! function. _redrawAllIndexes
00809         desc.
00810             Redraw a redraw of an index on the next call of _renderVertices
00811     */
00812     void _requestIndexRedraw(Ogre::uint index);
00813     
00814     /*! function. _renderVertices
00815         desc.
00816             Bundle up mIndexData (redraw any if needed) then copy them
00817             into mVertexBuffer, and update mRenderOpPtr with the new 
00818             vertex count.
00819     */
00820     void _renderVertices(bool force = false);
00821     
00822     /*! function. renderOnce
00823         desc.
00824             Draw the vertices from mVertexBuffer into Ogre.
00825     */
00826     virtual void renderOnce() = 0;
00827     
00828     virtual void _transform(buffer<Vertex>& vertices, size_t begin, size_t end) {}
00829     
00830    protected:
00831     
00832     /// mLayers -- Master copy of all layers of this Target.
00833     std::vector<Layer*>     mLayers;
00834     
00835     struct IndexData : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00836     {
00837      std::vector<Layer*>    mLayers;
00838      buffer<Vertex>         mVertices;
00839      bool                   mRedrawNeeded;
00840     };
00841     
00842     /// mIndexes -- Copies pointers to Layers arranged their index.
00843     std::map< Ogre::uint, IndexData* >  mIndexData;
00844     
00845     /// mIndexRedrawNeeded -- An index (not sure what) needs to be redrawn.
00846     bool  mIndexRedrawNeeded;
00847     
00848     /// mRedrawAll -- All indexes need to be redrawn regardless of state.
00849     bool  mIndexRedrawAll;
00850     
00851     /// mVertexBuffer -- Compiled layers of all indexes go into here for rendering directly to the screen or scene.
00852     Ogre::HardwareVertexBufferSharedPtr   mVertexBuffer;
00853     
00854     /// mVertexBufferSize -- How much the VertexBuffer can hold.
00855     size_t  mVertexBufferSize;
00856     
00857     /// mRenderOpPtr -- Pointer to the RenderOperation (Not owned by LayerContainer)
00858     Ogre::RenderOperation*  mRenderOpPtr;
00859     
00860     /// Atlas assigned to this LayerContainer
00861     TextureAtlas*  mAtlas;
00862     
00863   };
00864   
00865   
00866   class Screen : public LayerContainer, public Ogre::RenderQueueListener, public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
00867   {
00868    public:
00869     
00870     friend class Silverback;
00871     friend class Layer;
00872     
00873     /*! desc. getTexelOffsetX
00874             Helper function to get horizontal texel offset.
00875     */
00876     inline Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetX() const { return mRenderSystem->getHorizontalTexelOffset(); }
00877 
00878     /*! desc. getTexelOffsetY
00879             Helper function to get vertical texel offset.
00880     */
00881     inline Ogre::Real getTexelOffsetY() const { return mRenderSystem->getVerticalTexelOffset(); }
00882     
00883     /*! desc. getWidth
00884             Get screen height in pixels.
00885     */
00886     inline Ogre::Real getWidth() const { return mWidth; }
00887     
00888     /*! desc. getHeight
00889             Get screen height in pixels.
00890     */
00891     inline Ogre::Real getHeight() const { return mHeight; }
00892     
00893     /*! desc. isVisible
00894             Is the screen and it's contents visible or not?
00895         note.
00896             If the screen is hidden, then it is not rendered which decrease the batch count by one.
00897     */
00898     inline bool isVisible() const { return mIsVisible; }
00899     
00900     /*! desc. setVisible
00901             Show or hide the screen.
00902     */
00903     inline void setVisible(bool value) { mIsVisible = value;}
00904     
00905     /*! desc. hide
00906             Hide the screen and the all of layers within it.
00907     */
00908     inline void hide() { mIsVisible = false;}
00909     
00910     /*! desc. show
00911             Show the screen and the visible layers within it.
00912     */
00913     inline void show() { mIsVisible = true;}
00914     
00915 #if OGRE_NO_VIEWPORT_ORIENTATIONMODE == 1
00916     inline void setOrientation(Ogre::OrientationMode o)
00917     {
00918       mOrientation = o; mOrientationChanged = true;
00919 
00920       if (mOrientation == Ogre::OR_DEGREE_90 || mOrientation == Ogre::OR_DEGREE_270)
00921       {
00922        std::swap(mWidth, mHeight);
00923        std::swap(mInvWidth, mInvHeight);
00924       }
00925     }
00926 #endif
00927    protected:
00928     
00929     /*! constructor. Screen
00930         desc.
00931             Use Silverback::createScreen
00932     */
00933     Screen(Ogre::Viewport*, TextureAtlas*);
00934     
00935     /*! destructor. Screen
00936         desc.
00937             Use Silverback::destroyScreen
00938     */
00939    ~Screen();
00940     
00941     // Internal -- Not used, but required by renderQueueListener
00942     void renderQueueStarted(Ogre::uint8, const Ogre::String&, bool&) {}
00943     
00944     // Internal -- Called by Ogre to render the screen.
00945     void renderQueueEnded(Ogre::uint8 queueGroupId, const Ogre::String& invocation, bool& repeatThisInvocation);
00946     
00947     // Internal -- Prepares RenderSystem for rendering.
00948     void _prepareRenderSystem();
00949     
00950     // Internal -- Renders mVertexData to screen.
00951     void renderOnce();
00952     
00953     // Internal -- Used to transform vertices using units of pixels into screen coordinates.
00954     void _transform(buffer<Vertex>& vertices, size_t begin, size_t end);
00955     
00956     Ogre::RenderOperation mRenderOp;
00957     Ogre::SceneManager*   mSceneMgr;
00958     Ogre::RenderSystem*   mRenderSystem;
00959     Ogre::Viewport*       mViewport;
00960     Ogre::Real            mWidth, mHeight, mInvWidth, mInvHeight;
00961     Ogre::OrientationMode mOrientation;
00962 #if OGRE_NO_VIEWPORT_ORIENTATIONMODE == 1
00963     bool                  mOrientationChanged;
00964 #endif
00965     Ogre::Vector3         mScale;
00966     bool                  mIsVisible;
00967     bool                  mCanRender;
00968     Ogre::Matrix4         mVertexTransform;
00969     
00970   };
00971   
00972   class ScreenRenderable : public LayerContainer, public Ogre::SimpleRenderable
00973   {
00974    
00975    public:
00976     
00977     ScreenRenderable(const Ogre::Vector2& maxSize, TextureAtlas*);
00978     
00979    ~ScreenRenderable();
00980     
00981     void frameStarted();
00982     void renderOnce();
00983     void _transform(buffer<Vertex>& vertices, size_t begin, size_t end);
00984     void calculateBoundingBox();
00985 
00986     Ogre::Real getBoundingRadius(void) const { return mBox.getMaximum().squaredLength(); }
00987   
00988     Ogre::Real getSquaredViewDepth(const Ogre::Camera* cam) const
00989     {
00990      Ogre::Vector3 min, max, mid, dist;
00991      min = mBox.getMinimum();
00992      max = mBox.getMaximum();
00993      mid = ((max - min) * 0.5) + min;
00994      dist = cam->getDerivedPosition() - mid;
00995      return dist.squaredLength();
00996     }
00997     
00998    protected:
00999     
01000     Ogre::SceneManager*   mSceneMgr;
01001     Ogre::RenderSystem*   mRenderSystem;
01002     Ogre::Viewport*       mViewport;
01003     Ogre::Vector2         mMaxSize;
01004     
01005   };
01006   
01007   /*! class. Layer
01008       desc.
01009           Text
01010   */
01011   class Layer : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
01012   {
01013    
01014    friend class LayerContainer;
01015    
01016    public:
01017     
01018     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<Rectangle*>::type            Rectangles;
01019     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<Rectangles>                 RectangleIterator;
01020     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<Polygon*>::type              Polygons;
01021     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<Polygons>                   PolygonIterator;
01022     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<LineList*>::type             LineLists;
01023     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<LineLists>                  LineListIterator;
01024     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<QuadList*>::type             QuadLists;
01025     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<QuadLists>                  QuadListIterator;
01026     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<Caption*>::type              Captions;
01027     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<Captions>                   CaptionIterator;
01028     typedef Gorilla::VectorType<MarkupText*>::type           MarkupTexts;
01029     typedef Ogre::VectorIterator<MarkupTexts>                MarkupTextIterator;
01030     
01031     /*! function. isVisible
01032         desc.
01033             Is the layer being drawn on screen or not?
01034     */
01035     inline  bool isVisible() const
01036     {
01037      return mVisible;
01038     }
01039     
01040     /*! function. setVisible
01041         desc.
01042             Show or hide the layer
01043     */
01044     inline void setVisible(bool isVisible)
01045     {
01046      if (mVisible == isVisible)
01047       return;
01048      mVisible = isVisible;
01049      _markDirty();
01050     }
01051     
01052     /*! function. show
01053         desc.
01054             Show the layer
01055     */
01056     inline void show()
01057     {
01058      if (mVisible)
01059       return;
01060      mVisible = true;
01061      _markDirty();
01062     }
01063 
01064     /*! function. hide
01065         desc.
01066             hide the layer
01067     */
01068     inline void hide()
01069     {
01070      if (!mVisible)
01071       return;
01072      mVisible = false;
01073      _markDirty();
01074     }
01075     
01076     /*! function. setAlphaModifier
01077         desc.
01078             Set's a modifier to the alpha component of all colours of the vertices that make up this layer
01079         note.
01080             Final alpha value of all vertices in this layer is the following:
01081               
01082              final_alpha = vertex_alpha * alphaModifier;
01083             
01084             Alpha modifier should be between 0.0 and 1.0
01085     */
01086     void setAlphaModifier(const Ogre::Real& alphaModifier)
01087     {
01088      mAlphaModifier = alphaModifier;
01089      _markDirty();
01090     }
01091     
01092     /*! function. getAlphaModifier
01093         desc.
01094             Set's a modifier to the alpha component of all colours of the vertices that make up this layer
01095     */
01096     Ogre::Real getAlphaModifier() const
01097     {
01098      return mAlphaModifier;
01099     }
01100     
01101     /*! function. createRectangle
01102         desc.
01103             Creates a rectangle.
01104     */
01105     Rectangle*         createRectangle(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real width = 100, Ogre::Real height = 100);
01106     
01107     /*! function. createRectangle
01108         desc.
01109             Creates a rectangle.
01110     */
01111     Rectangle*         createRectangle(const Ogre::Vector2& position, const Ogre::Vector2& size = Ogre::Vector2(100,100))
01112     {
01113      return createRectangle(position.x, position.y, size.x, size.y);
01114     }
01115     
01116     /*! function. destroyRectangle
01117         desc.
01118             Removes a rectangle from the layer and *deletes* it.
01119     */
01120     void               destroyRectangle(Rectangle*);
01121     
01122     /*! function. destroyAllRectangles
01123         desc.
01124             Removes all rectangles from the layer and *deletes* them.
01125     */
01126     void               destroyAllRectangles();
01127     
01128     /*! function. getRectangles
01129         desc.
01130             Get an iterator to all the rectangles in this layer.
01131     */
01132     RectangleIterator  getRectangles()
01133     {
01134      return RectangleIterator(mRectangles.begin(), mRectangles.end());
01135     }
01136     
01137     /*! function. createPolygon
01138         desc.
01139             Creates a regular polygon.
01140     */
01141     Polygon*         createPolygon(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real radius = 100, Ogre::uint sides = 6);
01142     
01143     /*! function. destroyPolygon
01144         desc.
01145             Removes a polygon from the layer and *deletes* it.
01146     */
01147     void               destroyPolygon(Polygon*);
01148     
01149     /*! function. destroyAllPolygons
01150         desc.
01151             Removes all polygons from the layer and *deletes* them.
01152     */
01153     void               destroyAllPolygons();
01154     
01155     /*! function. getPolygons
01156         desc.
01157             Get an iterator to all the polygons in this layer.
01158     */
01159     PolygonIterator  getPolygons()
01160     {
01161      return PolygonIterator(mPolygons.begin(), mPolygons.end());
01162     }
01163     
01164     
01165     /*! function. createLineList
01166         desc.
01167             Creates a line list.
01168     */
01169     LineList*         createLineList();
01170     
01171     /*! function. destroyLineList
01172         desc.
01173             Removes a line list from the layer and *deletes* it.
01174     */
01175     void               destroyLineList(LineList*);
01176     
01177     /*! function. destroyAllLineLists
01178         desc.
01179             Removes all line lists from the layer and *deletes* them.
01180     */
01181     void               destroyAllLineLists();
01182     
01183     /*! function. getLineLists
01184         desc.
01185             Get an iterator to all the line lists in this layer.
01186     */
01187     LineListIterator  getLineLists()
01188     {
01189      return LineListIterator(mLineLists.begin(), mLineLists.end());
01190     }
01191     
01192     /*! function. createQuadList
01193         desc.
01194             Creates a quad list.
01195     */
01196     QuadList*         createQuadList();
01197     
01198     /*! function. destroyQuadList
01199         desc.
01200             Removes a quad list from the layer and *deletes* it.
01201     */
01202     void               destroyQuadList(QuadList*);
01203     
01204     /*! function. destroyAllQuadLists
01205         desc.
01206             Removes all quad lists from the layer and *deletes* them.
01207     */
01208     void               destroyAllQuadLists();
01209     
01210     /*! function. getQuadLists
01211         desc.
01212             Get an iterator to all the quad lists in this layer.
01213     */
01214     QuadListIterator  getQuadLists()
01215     {
01216      return QuadListIterator(mQuadLists.begin(), mQuadLists.end());
01217     }
01218     
01219     /*! function. createCaption
01220         desc.
01221             Creates a caption
01222     */
01223     Caption*         createCaption(Ogre::uint glyphDataIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, const Ogre::String& text);
01224     
01225     /*! function. destroyCaption
01226         desc.
01227             Removes a caption from the layer and *deletes* it.
01228     */
01229     void               destroyCaption(Caption*);
01230     
01231     /*! function. destroyAllCaptions
01232         desc.
01233             Removes all caption from the layer and *deletes* them.
01234     */
01235     void               destroyAllCaptions();
01236     
01237     /*! function. getCaptions
01238         desc.
01239             Get an iterator to all the quad lists in this layer.
01240     */
01241     CaptionIterator  getCaptions()
01242     {
01243      return CaptionIterator(mCaptions.begin(), mCaptions.end());
01244     }
01245 
01246     /*! function. createMarkupText
01247         desc.
01248             Creates a markup text
01249     */
01250     MarkupText*         createMarkupText(Ogre::uint defaultGlyphIndex, Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y, const Ogre::String& text);
01251     
01252     /*! function. destroyMarkupText
01253         desc.
01254             Removes a markup text from the layer and *deletes* it.
01255     */
01256     void               destroyMarkupText(MarkupText*);
01257     
01258     /*! function. destroyAllMarkupTexts
01259         desc.
01260             Removes all markup text from the layer and *deletes* them.
01261     */
01262     void               destroyAllMarkupTexts();
01263     
01264     /*! function. getMarkupTexts
01265         desc.
01266             Get an iterator to all the quad lists in this layer.
01267     */
01268     MarkupTextIterator  getMarkupTexts()
01269     {
01270      return MarkupTextIterator(mMarkupTexts.begin(), mMarkupTexts.end());
01271     }
01272 
01273     /*! function. getIndex
01274         desc.
01275             Get render index
01276     */
01277     Ogre::uint getIndex() const
01278     {
01279      return mIndex;
01280     }
01281     
01282     /*! function. _getSolidUV
01283         desc.
01284             Helper function to get a white pixel in the TextureAtlas.
01285     */
01286     inline Ogre::Vector2      _getSolidUV() const
01287     {
01288      return mParent->getAtlas()->getWhitePixel();
01289     }
01290     
01291     /*! function. _getSprite
01292         desc.
01293             Helper function to get a Sprite from the assigned texture atlas.
01294     */
01295     inline Sprite*            _getSprite(const Ogre::String& sprite_name) const
01296     {
01297      return mParent->getAtlas()->getSprite(sprite_name);
01298     }
01299     
01300     /*! function. _getGlyph
01301         desc.
01302             Helper function to get a Glyph from the assigned texture atlas.
01303     */
01304     inline GlyphData*         _getGlyphData(Ogre::uint id) const
01305     {
01306      return mParent->getAtlas()->getGlyphData(id);
01307     }
01308     
01309     /*! function. _getGlyph
01310         desc.
01311             Helper function to get the used texture size.
01312     */
01313     inline Ogre::Vector2      _getTextureSize() const
01314     {
01315      return mParent->getAtlas()->getTextureSize();
01316     }
01317     
01318     /*! function. _getAtlas
01319         desc.
01320             Helper function to get the used TextureAtlas.
01321     */
01322     inline TextureAtlas*      _getAtlas() const
01323     {
01324      return mParent->getAtlas();
01325     }
01326     
01327     /*! function. _getTexelX
01328         desc.
01329             Helper function to get the offset X texel coordinate.
01330     */
01331     inline Ogre::Real         _getTexelX() const
01332     {
01333      return mParent->getTexelOffsetX();
01334     }
01335     
01336     /*! function. _getTexelX
01337         desc.
01338             Helper function to get the offset Y texel coordinate.
01339     */
01340     inline Ogre::Real         _getTexelY() const
01341     {
01342      return mParent->getTexelOffsetY();
01343     }
01344     
01345     /*! function. _getMarkupColour
01346         desc.
01347             Helper function to get the markup colourvalue.
01348     */
01349     inline Ogre::ColourValue  _getMarkupColour(Ogre::uint index) const
01350     {
01351      return mParent->getAtlas()->getMarkupColour(index);
01352     }
01353     
01354     /*! function. _markDirty
01355         desc.
01356             Make this layer redraw itself on the next time that
01357             Gorilla updates to the screen.
01358         note.
01359             This shouldn't be needed to be called by the user.
01360     */
01361     void _markDirty();
01362     
01363    protected:
01364     
01365     void _render(buffer<Vertex>&, bool force = false);
01366 
01367     Layer(Ogre::uint index, LayerContainer*);
01368     
01369    ~Layer();
01370     
01371     Ogre::uint               mIndex;
01372     Rectangles               mRectangles;
01373     Polygons                 mPolygons;
01374     LineLists                mLineLists;
01375     QuadLists                mQuadLists;
01376     Captions                 mCaptions;
01377     MarkupTexts              mMarkupTexts;
01378     LayerContainer*          mParent;
01379     bool                     mVisible;
01380     Ogre::Real               mAlphaModifier;
01381     
01382   };
01383   
01384   /*! class. Rectangle
01385       desc.
01386           Single rectangle with an optional border.
01387   */
01388   class Rectangle : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
01389   {
01390    
01391    friend class Layer;
01392    
01393    public:
01394     
01395     /*! function. intersects
01396         desc.
01397             Does a set of coordinates lie within this rectangle?
01398     */
01399     inline bool intersects(const Ogre::Vector2& coordinates) const
01400     {
01401      return ((coordinates.x >= mLeft && coordinates.x <= mRight) && (coordinates.y >= mTop && coordinates.y <= mBottom));
01402     }
01403     
01404     /*! function. position
01405         desc.
01406             Get the position
01407     */
01408     inline Ogre::Vector2 position() const
01409     {
01410      return Ogre::Vector2(mLeft, mTop);
01411     }
01412     
01413     /*! function. position
01414         desc.
01415             Set the position
01416     */
01417     inline void position(const Ogre::Real& l, const Ogre::Real& t)
01418     {
01419      left(l);
01420      top(t);
01421     }
01422     /*! function. position
01423         desc.
01424             Set the position
01425     */
01426     inline void position(const Ogre::Vector2& position)
01427     {
01428      left(position.x);
01429      top(position.y);
01430     }
01431     
01432     /*! function. left 
01433         desc.
01434             Get left position
01435     */
01436     inline Ogre::Real  left() const
01437     {
01438      return mLeft;
01439     }
01440 
01441     /*! function. left 
01442         desc.
01443             Set left position
01444     */
01445     inline void  left(const Ogre::Real& left)
01446     {
01447      Ogre::Real w = width();
01448      mLeft = left;
01449      mRight = left + w;
01450      mDirty = true;
01451      mLayer->_markDirty();
01452     }
01453 
01454     /*! function. top 
01455         desc.
01456             Get top position
01457     */
01458     inline Ogre::Real  top() const
01459     {
01460      return mTop;
01461     }
01462 
01463     /*! function. top 
01464         desc.
01465             Set top position
01466     */
01467     inline void  top(const Ogre::Real& top)
01468     {
01469      Ogre::Real h = height();
01470      mTop = top;
01471      mBottom = top + h;
01472      mDirty = true;
01473      mLayer->_markDirty();
01474     }
01475 
01476     /*! function. width 
01477         desc.
01478             Get the width
01479     */
01480     inline Ogre::Real  width() const
01481     {
01482      return mRight - mLeft;
01483     }
01484 
01485     /*! function. width 
01486         desc.
01487             Set the width
01488     */
01489     inline void  width(const Ogre::Real& width)
01490     {
01491      mRight = mLeft + width;
01492      mDirty = true;
01493      mLayer->_markDirty();
01494     }
01495 
01496     /*! function. height 
01497         desc.
01498             Get the height
01499     */
01500     Ogre::Real  height() const
01501     {
01502      return mBottom - mTop;
01503     }
01504 
01505     /*! function. height 
01506         desc.
01507             Set the height
01508     */
01509     inline void  height(const Ogre::Real& height)
01510     {
01511      mBottom = mTop + height;
01512      mDirty = true;
01513      mLayer->_markDirty();
01514     }
01515     
01516     /*! function. no_background 
01517         desc.
01518             Don't draw the background.
01519         note.
01520             This just sets the background colour alpha to zero. Which on the next
01521             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the background.
01522     */
01523     void  no_background()
01524     {
01525      mBackgroundColour[0].a = 0;
01526      mDirty = true;
01527      mLayer->_markDirty();
01528     }
01529 
01530     /*! function. no_border 
01531         desc.
01532             Don't draw the border.
01533         note.
01534             This just sets the border to zero. Which on the next
01535             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the border.
01536     */
01537     void  no_border()
01538     {
01539      mBorderWidth = 0;
01540      mDirty = true;
01541      mLayer->_markDirty();
01542     }
01543     
01544     /*! function. background_colour
01545         desc.
01546             Get a background colour of a specific corner.
01547     */
01548     Ogre::ColourValue  background_colour(QuadCorner index) const
01549     {
01550      return mBackgroundColour[index];
01551     }
01552 
01553     /*! function. background_colour
01554         desc.
01555             Set a background colour to all corners.
01556     */
01557     void  background_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
01558     {
01559      mBackgroundColour[0] = colour;
01560      mBackgroundColour[1] = colour;
01561      mBackgroundColour[2] = colour;
01562      mBackgroundColour[3] = colour;
01563      mDirty = true;
01564      mLayer->_markDirty();
01565     }
01566 
01567     /*! function. background_colour
01568         desc.
01569             Set a background colour to all corners.
01570     */
01571     void  background_colour(Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
01572     {
01573      mBackgroundColour[0] = webcolour(colour);
01574      mBackgroundColour[1] = mBackgroundColour[0];
01575      mBackgroundColour[2] = mBackgroundColour[0];
01576      mBackgroundColour[3] = mBackgroundColour[0];
01577      mDirty = true;
01578      mLayer->_markDirty();
01579     }
01580     
01581     /*! function. background_colour
01582         desc.
01583             Set a background colour to a specific corner.
01584     */
01585     void  background_colour(QuadCorner index, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
01586     {
01587      mBorderColour[index] = colour;
01588      mDirty = true;
01589      mLayer->_markDirty();
01590     }
01591     
01592     /*! function. background_gradient
01593         desc.
01594             Set the background to a gradient.
01595     */
01596     void  background_gradient(Gradient gradient, const Ogre::ColourValue& colourA, const Ogre::ColourValue& colourB)
01597     {
01598      if (gradient == Gradient_NorthSouth)
01599      {
01600       mBackgroundColour[0] = mBackgroundColour[1] = colourA;
01601       mBackgroundColour[2] = mBackgroundColour[3] = colourB;
01602      }
01603      else if (gradient == Gradient_WestEast)
01604      {
01605       mBackgroundColour[0] = mBackgroundColour[3] = colourA;
01606       mBackgroundColour[1] = mBackgroundColour[2] = colourB;
01607      }
01608      else if (gradient == Gradient_Diagonal)
01609      {
01610       Ogre::ColourValue avg;
01611       avg.r = (colourA.r + colourB.r) * 0.5f;
01612       avg.g = (colourA.g + colourB.g) * 0.5f;
01613       avg.b = (colourA.b + colourB.b) * 0.5f;
01614       avg.a = (colourA.a + colourB.a) * 0.5f;
01615       mBackgroundColour[0] = colourA;
01616       mBackgroundColour[1] = avg = mBackgroundColour[3] = avg;
01617       mBackgroundColour[2] = colourB;
01618      }
01619      mDirty = true;
01620      mLayer->_markDirty();
01621     }
01622     
01623     /*! function. background_image
01624         desc.
01625             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas.
01626         note.
01627             To remove the image pass on a null pointer.
01628     */
01629     void  background_image(Sprite* sprite)
01630     {
01631      if (sprite == 0)
01632      {
01633       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01634      }
01635      else
01636      {
01637       if (sprite == 0)
01638       {
01639 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01640        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01641 #else
01642        return;
01643 #endif
01644       }
01645       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01646       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01647       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01648       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01649       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01650       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvRight + texelOffsetX;
01651       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvBottom + texelOffsetX;
01652      }
01653      mDirty = true;
01654      mLayer->_markDirty();
01655     }
01656     
01657     /*! function. background_image
01658         desc.
01659             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas, with clipping.
01660             Clipping is used for example with RPM meters on HUDs, where a portion
01661             of the sprite needs to be shown to indicate the RPM on the car.
01662             
01663             widthClip  is a decimal percentage of the width of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01664             heightClip is a decimal percentage of the height of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01665             
01666             You should use this with the width() and height() functions for a full effect.
01667         note.
01668             To remove the image pass on a null pointer.
01669     */
01670     void  background_image(Sprite* sprite, Ogre::Real widthClip, Ogre::Real heightClip)
01671     {
01672      if (sprite == 0)
01673      {
01674       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01675      }
01676      else
01677      {
01678       if (sprite == 0)
01679       {
01680 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01681        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01682 #else
01683        return;
01684 #endif
01685       }
01686       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01687       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01688       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01689       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01690       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01691       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvLeft + ( (sprite->uvRight - sprite->uvLeft) * widthClip ) + texelOffsetX;
01692       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvTop + ( (sprite->uvBottom - sprite->uvTop) * heightClip ) + texelOffsetY;
01693      }
01694      mDirty = true;
01695      mLayer->_markDirty();
01696     }
01697     
01698     /*! function. background_image
01699         desc.
01700             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas, with clipping.
01701             Clipping is used for example with RPM meters on HUDs, where a portion
01702             of the sprite needs to be shown to indicate the RPM on the car.
01703             
01704             widthClip  is a decimal percentage of the width of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01705             heightClip is a decimal percentage of the height of the sprite (0.0 none, 1.0 full)
01706             
01707             You should use this with the width() and height() functions for a full effect.
01708         note.
01709             To remove the image pass on a null pointer.
01710     */
01711     void  background_image(const Ogre::String& sprite_name_or_none, Ogre::Real widthClip, Ogre::Real heightClip)
01712     {
01713      if (sprite_name_or_none.length() == 0 || sprite_name_or_none == "none")
01714      {
01715       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01716      }
01717      else
01718      {
01719       Sprite* sprite = mLayer->_getSprite(sprite_name_or_none);
01720       if (sprite == 0)
01721       {
01722 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01723        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01724 #else
01725        return;
01726 #endif
01727       }
01728       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01729       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01730       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01731       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01732       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01733       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvLeft + ( (sprite->uvRight - sprite->uvLeft) * widthClip ) + texelOffsetX;
01734       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvTop + ( (sprite->uvBottom - sprite->uvTop) * heightClip ) + texelOffsetY;
01735      }
01736      mDirty = true;
01737      mLayer->_markDirty();
01738     }
01739 
01740     /*! function. background_image
01741         desc.
01742             Set the background to a sprite from the texture atlas.
01743         note.
01744             To remove the image pass on "none" or a empty string
01745     */
01746     void  background_image(const Ogre::String& sprite_name_or_none)
01747     {
01748      if (sprite_name_or_none.length() == 0 || sprite_name_or_none == "none")
01749      {
01750       mUV[0] = mUV[1] = mUV[2] = mUV[3] = mLayer->_getSolidUV();
01751      }
01752      else
01753      {
01754       Sprite* sprite = mLayer->_getSprite(sprite_name_or_none);
01755       if (sprite == 0)
01756       {
01757 #if GORILLA_USES_EXCEPTIONS == 1
01758        OGRE_EXCEPT( Ogre::Exception::ERR_ITEM_NOT_FOUND, "Sprite name not found", __FUNC__ );
01759 #else
01760        return;
01761 #endif
01762       }
01763       
01764       Ogre::Real texelOffsetX = mLayer->_getTexelX(), texelOffsetY = mLayer->_getTexelY();
01765       texelOffsetX /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().x;
01766       texelOffsetY /= mLayer->_getTextureSize().y;
01767       mUV[0].x = mUV[3].x = sprite->uvLeft - texelOffsetX;
01768       mUV[0].y = mUV[1].y = sprite->uvTop - texelOffsetY;
01769       mUV[1].x = mUV[2].x = sprite->uvRight + texelOffsetX;
01770       mUV[2].y = mUV[3].y = sprite->uvBottom + texelOffsetY;
01771      }
01772      mDirty = true;
01773      mLayer->_markDirty();
01774     }
01775     
01776     /*! function. border_colour
01777         desc.
01778             Get the border colour.
01779     */
01780     Ogre::ColourValue  border_colour(Border index) const
01781     {
01782      return mBorderColour[index];
01783     }
01784 
01785     /*! function. border_colour
01786         desc.
01787             Set all of border to one colour 
01788     */
01789     void  border_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& bordercolour)
01790     {
01791      mBorderColour[0] = bordercolour;
01792      mBorderColour[1] = bordercolour;
01793      mBorderColour[2] = bordercolour;
01794      mBorderColour[3] = bordercolour;
01795      mDirty = true;
01796      mLayer->_markDirty();
01797     }
01798 
01799     /*! function. border_colour
01800         desc.
01801             Set a border part to one colour. 
01802     */
01803     void  border_colour(Border index, const Ogre::ColourValue& bordercolour)
01804     {
01805      mBorderColour[index] = bordercolour;
01806      mDirty = true;
01807      mLayer->_markDirty();
01808     }
01809     
01810     /*! function. border_colour
01811         desc.
01812             Set all of border to one colour 
01813     */
01814     void  border_colour(Gorilla::Colours::Colour bordercolour)
01815     {
01816      mBorderColour[0] = webcolour(bordercolour);
01817      mBorderColour[1] = mBorderColour[0];
01818      mBorderColour[2] = mBorderColour[0];
01819      mBorderColour[3] = mBorderColour[0];
01820      mDirty = true;
01821      mLayer->_markDirty();
01822     }
01823 
01824     /*! function. border_colour
01825         desc.
01826             Set a border part to one colour. 
01827     */
01828     void  border_colour(Border index, Gorilla::Colours::Colour bordercolour)
01829     {
01830      mBorderColour[index] = webcolour(bordercolour);
01831      mDirty = true;
01832      mLayer->_markDirty();
01833     }
01834     
01835     /*! function. border_width
01836         desc.
01837             Get the border width
01838     */
01839     Ogre::Real  border_width() const
01840     {
01841      return mBorderWidth;
01842     }
01843 
01844     /*! function. border_width
01845         desc.
01846             Set the border width
01847     */
01848     void  border_width(Ogre::Real width)
01849     {
01850      mBorderWidth = width;
01851      mDirty = true;
01852      mLayer->_markDirty();
01853     }
01854     
01855     /*! function. border
01856         desc.
01857             Set the border width and colour.
01858     */
01859     void  border(Ogre::Real width, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
01860     {
01861      mBorderColour[0] = colour;
01862      mBorderColour[1] = mBorderColour[0];
01863      mBorderColour[2] = mBorderColour[0];
01864      mBorderColour[3] = mBorderColour[0];
01865      mBorderWidth = width;
01866      mDirty = true;
01867      mLayer->_markDirty();
01868     }
01869     
01870     /*! function. border
01871         desc.
01872             Set the border width and specific colours for each part.
01873     */
01874     void  border(Ogre::Real width, const Ogre::ColourValue& north, const Ogre::ColourValue& east, const Ogre::ColourValue& south, const Ogre::ColourValue& west)
01875     {
01876      mBorderColour[Border_North] = north;
01877      mBorderColour[Border_South] = south;
01878      mBorderColour[Border_East] = east;
01879      mBorderColour[Border_West] = west;
01880      mBorderWidth = width;
01881      mDirty = true;
01882      mLayer->_markDirty();
01883     }
01884     
01885     /*! function. border
01886         desc.
01887             Set the border width and colour.
01888     */
01889     void  border(Ogre::Real width, Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
01890     {
01891      mBorderColour[0] = webcolour(colour);
01892      mBorderColour[1] = mBorderColour[0];
01893      mBorderColour[2] = mBorderColour[0];
01894      mBorderColour[3] = mBorderColour[0];
01895      mBorderWidth = width;
01896      mDirty = true;
01897      mLayer->_markDirty();
01898     }
01899     
01900     /*! function. border
01901         desc.
01902             Set the border width and specific colours for each part.
01903     */
01904     void  border(Ogre::Real width, Gorilla::Colours::Colour north, Gorilla::Colours::Colour east, Gorilla::Colours::Colour south, Gorilla::Colours::Colour west)
01905     {
01906      mBorderColour[Border_North] = webcolour(north);
01907      mBorderColour[Border_South] = webcolour(south);
01908      mBorderColour[Border_East] = webcolour(east);
01909      mBorderColour[Border_West] = webcolour(west);
01910      mBorderWidth = width;
01911      mDirty = true;
01912      mLayer->_markDirty();
01913     }
01914 
01915     void SetVisible(bool Vis)
01916     {
01917      if (mVisible == Vis)
01918       return;
01919      mVisible = Vis;
01920      mDirty = true;
01921      mLayer->_markDirty();
01922     }
01923 
01924     bool IsVisible() const
01925     {
01926      return mVisible;
01927     }
01928 
01929     void Show()
01930     {
01931      if (mVisible)
01932       return;
01933      mVisible = true;
01934      mDirty = true;
01935      mLayer->_markDirty();
01936     }
01937 
01938     void Hide()
01939     {
01940      if (!mVisible)
01941       return;
01942      mVisible = false;
01943      mDirty = true;
01944      mLayer->_markDirty();
01945     }
01946 
01947     void  RenderPriority(Gorilla::RenderPriority Priority)
01948     {
01949      mPriority = Priority;
01950     }
01951 
01952     Gorilla::RenderPriority RenderPriority()
01953     {
01954      return mPriority;
01955     }
01956 
01957     /*! function. _redraw
01958         desc.
01959             Redraw the rectangle
01960         note.
01961             This should not be needed to be called by the user.
01962     */
01963     void _redraw();
01964     
01965    protected:
01966     
01967     Rectangle(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real width, Ogre::Real height, Layer* parent);
01968     
01969    ~Rectangle() {}
01970     
01971    protected:
01972     
01973     Layer*             mLayer;
01974     Ogre::Real         mLeft, mTop, mRight, mBottom, mBorderWidth;
01975     Ogre::ColourValue  mBackgroundColour[4];
01976     Ogre::ColourValue  mBorderColour[4];
01977     Ogre::Vector2      mUV[4];
01978     bool               mDirty;
01979     bool               mVisible;
01980     buffer<Vertex>     mVertices;
01981     Gorilla::RenderPriority mPriority;
01982   };
01983   
01984   /*! class. Polygon
01985       desc.
01986           A regular n-sided polygon.
01987   */
01988   class Polygon : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
01989   {
01990    
01991    friend class Layer;
01992    
01993    public:
01994    
01995     /*! function. left 
01996         desc.
01997             Get left position
01998     */
01999     Ogre::Real  left() const
02000     {
02001      return mLeft;
02002     }
02003 
02004     /*! function. left 
02005         desc.
02006             Set left position
02007     */
02008     void  left(const Ogre::Real& left)
02009     {
02010      mLeft = left;
02011      mDirty = true;
02012      mLayer->_markDirty();
02013     }
02014 
02015     /*! function. left 
02016         desc.
02017             Get left position
02018     */
02019     Ogre::Real  top() const
02020     {
02021      return mTop;
02022     }
02023 
02024     /*! function. left 
02025         desc.
02026             Set left position
02027     */
02028     void  top(const Ogre::Real& top)
02029     {
02030      mTop = top;
02031      mDirty = true;
02032      mLayer->_markDirty();
02033     }
02034     
02035     /*! function. radius 
02036         desc.
02037             Get the radius of the polygon
02038     */
02039     Ogre::Real  radius() const
02040     {
02041      return mRadius;
02042     }
02043     
02044     /*! function. radius 
02045         desc.
02046             Set the radius of the polygon
02047     */
02048     void  radius(const Ogre::Real& radius)
02049     {
02050      mRadius = radius;
02051      mDirty = true;
02052      mLayer->_markDirty();
02053     }
02054     
02055     /*! function. sides 
02056         desc.
02057             Get the number of sides the polygon has.
02058     */
02059     size_t  sides() const
02060     {
02061      return mSides;
02062     }
02063     
02064     /*! function. sides 
02065         desc.
02066             Set the number of sides the polygon has.
02067         note.
02068             Number of sides must be at least 2.
02069     */
02070     void  sides(size_t sides)
02071     {
02072      if (sides < 3)
02073       sides = 3;
02074      mSides = sides;
02075      mDirty = true;
02076      mLayer->_markDirty();
02077     }
02078     
02079     /*! function. angle 
02080         desc.
02081             Get the angle of the polygon
02082     */
02083     Ogre::Radian  angle() const
02084     {
02085      return mAngle;
02086     }
02087     
02088     /*! function. angle 
02089         desc.
02090             Set the angle of the polygon.
02091     */
02092     void  angle(const Ogre::Radian& angle)
02093     {
02094      mAngle = angle;
02095      mDirty = true;
02096      mLayer->_markDirty();
02097     }
02098     
02099     /*! function. background_image 
02100         desc.
02101             Get the sprite used as a background image or null pointer
02102     */
02103     Sprite*  background_image() const
02104     {
02105      return mSprite;
02106     }
02107     
02108     /*! function. background_image 
02109         desc.
02110             Set the sprite used as a background image or null pointer to clear.
02111     */
02112     void  background_image(Sprite* sprite)
02113     {
02114      mSprite = sprite;
02115      mDirty = true;
02116      mLayer->_markDirty();
02117     }
02118     
02119     /*! function. background_image 
02120         desc.
02121             Set the sprite used as a background image from a string.
02122         note.
02123             Use a empty string or "none" to clear.
02124     */
02125     void  background_image(const Ogre::String& name_or_none)
02126     {
02127      if (name_or_none.size() == 0 || name_or_none == "none")
02128       mSprite = 0;
02129      else
02130       mSprite = mLayer->_getSprite(name_or_none);
02131      
02132      mDirty = true;
02133      mLayer->_markDirty();
02134     }
02135     
02136     /*! function. background_colour 
02137         desc.
02138             Get the background colour.
02139     */
02140     Ogre::ColourValue  background_colour() const
02141     {
02142      return mBackgroundColour;
02143     }
02144     
02145     /*! function. background_colour 
02146         desc.
02147             Set the background colour.
02148         note.
02149             If there is a background sprite then it will be tinted by this colour.
02150     */
02151     void  background_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
02152     {
02153      mBackgroundColour = colour;
02154      mDirty = true;
02155      mLayer->_markDirty();
02156     }
02157     
02158     /*! function. border 
02159         desc.
02160             Set the border width and colour
02161     */
02162     void border(Ogre::Real width, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour)
02163     {
02164      mBorderColour = colour;
02165      mBorderWidth = width;
02166      mDirty = true;
02167      mLayer->_markDirty();
02168     }
02169     
02170     /*! function. border 
02171         desc.
02172             Set the border width and colour
02173     */
02174     void border(Ogre::Real width, Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
02175     {
02176      if (colour == Gorilla::Colours::None)
02177      {
02178       mBorderColour.a = 0;
02179       mBorderWidth = 0;
02180      }
02181      else
02182      {
02183       mBorderColour = webcolour(colour);
02184       mBorderWidth = width;
02185      }
02186      mDirty = true;
02187      mLayer->_markDirty();
02188     }
02189 
02190     /*! function. border_colour 
02191         desc.
02192             Get the border colour
02193     */
02194     Ogre::ColourValue  border_colour() const
02195     {
02196      return mBorderColour;
02197     }
02198     
02199     /*! function. border_colour 
02200         desc.
02201             Set the border colour
02202     */
02203     void  border_colour(const Ogre::ColourValue& bordercolour)
02204     {
02205      mBorderColour = bordercolour;
02206      mDirty = true;
02207      mLayer->_markDirty();
02208     }
02209     
02210     /*! function. border_colour 
02211         desc.
02212             Set the border colour
02213     */
02214     void  border_colour(Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
02215     {
02216      if (colour == Gorilla::Colours::None)
02217      {
02218       mBorderColour.a = 0;
02219      }
02220      else
02221      {
02222       mBorderColour = webcolour(colour);
02223      }
02224      mDirty = true;
02225      mLayer->_markDirty();
02226     }
02227     
02228     /*! function. border_width 
02229         desc.
02230             Get the border width
02231     */
02232     Ogre::Real  border_width() const
02233     {
02234      return mBorderWidth;
02235     }
02236     
02237     /*! function. border_width 
02238         desc.
02239             Set the border width
02240     */
02241     void  border_width(Ogre::Real width)
02242     {
02243      mBorderWidth = width;
02244      mDirty = true;
02245      mLayer->_markDirty();
02246     }
02247     
02248 
02249     /*! function. no_background 
02250         desc.
02251             Don't draw the background.
02252         note.
02253             This just sets the background colour alpha to zero. Which on the next
02254             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the background.
02255     */
02256     void  no_background()
02257     {
02258      mBackgroundColour.a = 0;
02259      mDirty = true;
02260      mLayer->_markDirty();
02261     }
02262 
02263     /*! function. no_border 
02264         desc.
02265             Don't draw the border.
02266         note.
02267             This just sets the border to zero. Which on the next
02268             draw tells Rectangle to skip over drawing the border.
02269     */
02270     void  no_border()
02271     {
02272      mBorderWidth = 0;
02273      mDirty = true;
02274      mLayer->_markDirty();
02275     }
02276 
02277     void SetVisible(bool Vis)
02278     {
02279      if (mVisible == Vis)
02280       return;
02281      mVisible = Vis;
02282      mDirty = true;
02283      mLayer->_markDirty();
02284     }
02285 
02286     bool IsVisible() const
02287     {
02288      return mVisible;
02289     }
02290 
02291     void Show()
02292     {
02293      if (mVisible)
02294       return;
02295      mVisible = true;
02296      mDirty = true;
02297      mLayer->_markDirty();
02298     }
02299 
02300     void Hide()
02301     {
02302      if (!mVisible)
02303       return;
02304      mVisible = false;
02305      mDirty = true;
02306      mLayer->_markDirty();
02307     }
02308 
02309     void  RenderPriority(Gorilla::RenderPriority Priority)
02310     {
02311      mPriority = Priority;
02312     }
02313 
02314     Gorilla::RenderPriority RenderPriority()
02315     {
02316      return mPriority;
02317     }
02318 
02319     /*! function. _redraw
02320         desc.
02321             Redraw the polygon
02322         note.
02323             This should not be needed to be called by the user.
02324     */
02325     void  _redraw();
02326     
02327     protected:
02328     
02329      
02330     Polygon(Ogre::Real left, Ogre::Real top, Ogre::Real radius, size_t sides, Layer* parent);
02331     
02332    ~Polygon() {}
02333     
02334     Layer*             mLayer;
02335     Ogre::Real         mLeft, mTop, mRadius, mBorderWidth;
02336     Ogre::Radian       mAngle;
02337     size_t             mSides;
02338     Ogre::ColourValue  mBackgroundColour, mBorderColour;
02339     Sprite*            mSprite;
02340     bool               mDirty;
02341     bool               mVisible;
02342     buffer<Vertex>     mVertices;
02343     Gorilla::RenderPriority mPriority;
02344 
02345   };
02346   
02347   class LineList : public Ogre::GeneralAllocatedObject
02348   {
02349    
02350    friend class Layer;
02351    
02352    public:
02353     
02354     /*! function. begin
02355         desc.
02356             Clear lines and start again
02357     */
02358     void  begin(Ogre::Real lineThickness = 1.0f, const Ogre::ColourValue& colour = Ogre::ColourValue::White);
02359     
02360     /*! function. begin
02361         desc.
02362             Clear lines and start again
02363     */
02364     void  begin(Ogre::Real lineThickness, Gorilla::Colours::Colour colour)
02365     {
02366      begin(lineThickness, webcolour(colour));
02367     }
02368     
02369     /*! function. position
02370         desc.
02371             Extent the list to x and y.
02372     */
02373     void  position(Ogre::Real x, Ogre::Real y);
02374     
02375     /*! function. position
02376         desc.
02377             Extent the list to given coordinates.
02378     */
02379     void  position(const Ogre::Vector2&);
02380     
02381     /*! function. end
02382         desc.
02383             Stop line drawing and calculate vertices.
02384         note.
02385             If "isClosed" is set to true, then the line list joins back to the first position.
02386     */
02387     void  end(bool isClosed = false);
02388 
02389     void SetVisible(bool Vis)
02390     {
02391      if (mVisible == Vis)
02392       return;
02393      mVisible = Vis;
02394      mDirty = true;
02395      mLayer->_markDirty();
02396     }
02397 
02398     bool IsVisible() const
02399     {
02400      return mVisible;
02401     }
02402 
02403     void Show()
02404     {
02405      if (mVisible)
02406       return;
02407      mVisible = true;
02408      mDirty = true;
02409      mLayer->_markDirty();
02410     }
02411 
02412     void Hide()
02413     {
02414      if (!mVisible)
02415       return;
02416      mVisible = false;
02417      mDirty = true;
02418      mLayer->_markDirty();
02419     }
02420 
02421     void  RenderPriority(Gorilla::RenderPriority Priority)
02422     {
02423      mPriority = Priority;
02424     }
02425 
02426     Gorilla::RenderPriority RenderPriority()
02427     {
02428      return mPriority;
02429     }
02430 
02431     /*! function. _redraw
02432         desc.
02433             Redraw the line list
02434         note.
02435             This should not be needed to be called by the user.
02436     */
02437     void  _redraw();
02438     
02439    protected:
02440     
02441     LineList(Layer* parent);
02442     
02443    ~LineList() {}
02444     
02445    protected:
02446     
02447     Layer*                mLayer;
02448     Ogre::Real            mThickness;
02449     Ogre::ColourValue     mColour;
02450     bool                  mIsClosed;
02451     buffer<Ogre::Vector2> mPositions;
02452     bool                  mDirty;
02453     bool                  mVisible;
02454     buffer<Vertex>        mVertices;
02455     Gorilla::RenderPriority mPriority;
02456   };
